Orissa High Court

Uttam Digal vs ) State Of Odisha ..... Opposite Parties on 17 December, 2024

 IN THE HIGH COURT OF ORISSA AT CUTTACK
 BLAPL No.7175 of 2024
 Uttam Digal ..... Petitioner
 Represented By Adv. -
 Susanta Kumar Lenka

 -versus-
 1) State Of Odisha ..... Opposite Parties
 2) Chinmayee Digal Represented By Adv. -

 B.K. Sahu, AGA

 CORAM:
 THE HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE ANANDA CHANDRA
 BEHERA

 ORDER

 17.12.2024
 Order No.

 03. 1. This matter is taken up through hybrid mode.

 2. The bail application under 
Section 439
 of the
 Cr.P.C., 1973 filed by the petitioner arising out of K.
 Nuagaon P.S. Case No.36 of 2024 corresponding to
 C.T. Case No.29 of 2024 pending before the learned
 Addl. District &Sessions Judge-cum-Special Court
 under 
POCSO Act
, Phulbani is taken up into
 consideration.

 3. The petitioner is facing trial in the Court of
 learned Addl. District & Sessions Judge-cum-Special
 Court under 
POCSO Act
, Phulbani in C.T. Case No.29
 of 2024 having been charged under 
Sections 363
, 
366

376(2)(n)
, 
376(3)
 IPC, 1860 read with 
Section 4(2)

 &
6(1)
 of the POCSO Act, 2012 on the allegations of
 commission of rape on the victim.

Signature Not Verified

 Page 1 of 3.

Digitally Signed

Signed by: UTKALIKA NAYAK

Reason: Authentication

Location: High Court of

Orissa, Cuttack

Date: 17-Dec-2024 16:53:01

 4. I have already heard from the learned counsel for
 the petitioner and learned Addl. Govt. Advocate for the
 State.

 5. During the course of hearing, learned counsel for
 the petitioner submitted for liberal consideration of bail
 of the petitioner contending that, the petitioner is in jail
 custody since 20.04.2024 and in the meantime, during
 trial, the victim has already been examined as P.W.7,
 but, the victim has not supported case of the prosecution
 during trial, to which, learned Addl. Govt. Advocate
 objected contending that, as because, the trial is going
 on, for which, he (petitioner) should not be allowed to
 go on bail.

 6. On perusal of copy of the deposition of the
 witnesses submitted by the Trial Court, it appears that,
 in fact the victim has not supported the case of the
 prosecution during trial, for which, she (victim) has
 turned hostile on being examined as P.W.7 during trial.

 7. When the victim has not supported the case of
 prosecution during trial and she (victim) has turned
 hostile to the prosecution, then at this juncture, by
 taking the aforesaid evidence of the victim during trial
 into account, I find no justification to disallow the
 prayer for bail of the petitioner.

 8. Therefore, the bail application filed by the
 petitioner is allowed.

Signature Not Verified

 Page 2 of 3.

Digitally Signed

Signed by: UTKALIKA NAYAK

Reason: Authentication

Location: High Court of

Orissa, Cuttack

Date: 17-Dec-2024 16:53:01

 9. He (petitioner) is allowed to go on bail on
 furnishing bail bond of Rs.50,000/-(rupees fifty thousand)
 with two solvent sureties each for the like amount to the
 satisfaction of the learned Court in seisin over the matter
 with conditions that :-

 (i) he (petitioner) shall not involve with
 similar nature of crime in future;

 (ii) he shall appear before the Trial Court
 personally on each date of adjournment of the
 case without fail till the conclusion of trial;

 (iii) he shall not terrorize, coerce, influence
 or threat any witnesses of the prosecution
 including the informant and her family members
 either directly or indirectly in any manner
 whatsoever at any stage of the proceeding of the
 case, but in case of his failure to comply any of
 the aforesaid conditions, the court in seisin over
 the matter is authorized to cancel his bail order
 out-rightly without seeking any permission for
 the same from this Court.

 10. Accordingly, the bail application filed by the
 petitioner is disposed of finally.

 11. Grant certified copy of this order to the petitioner
 on proper application.

 (ANANDA CHANDRA BEHERA)
 Judge
 Utkalika
